segments.text: I notice the boy stretching toward the cookie jar, barely balancing on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, waiting for a cookie like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it could collapse at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little happy seeing their teamwork, even if it’s mischievous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on that plate, completely missing what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever turn around and catch them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so serene, like nothing bad could ever happen there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one gets hurt before she finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR
